meanings.definition: To jump or spring a long way, to a great height, or with great force.
meanings.sent1: The frog will leap over the pond.
meanings.sent2: She watched the dancer leap gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo challenged the rabbit to a leap competition.
meanings.sent4: Her heart made a leap when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's powerful leap broke the long jump record.

meanings.sent1: With a leap, the cat caught the mouse.
meanings.sent2: The sudden leap of the squirrel startled me.
meanings.sent3: The leap of the fish out of the water was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The leap of the flames from the campfire was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The leap of the ball into the air surprised the players.
